subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] bear beer
msgSnippet: ... Okay. fare and fear are identical, as are hare and hear. The vowels in fleece, dress, and face are completely different. If I were to say humorously
messageBody:
Anthony Grahn wrote:
>
>
>
> May I ask: is bear-beer homonym something that only happens with R?
> what about fare vs fear. hare vs hear.
> what about fleece dress face
> what about deed met bake
>

Okay. fare and fear are identical, as are hare and hear.

The vowels in fleece, dress, and face are completely different. If I
were to say humorously "meece" for the plural of mouse, that would be
very different than "mace" the stuff in a can. And mess would be just as
different as the other two.

Same as "dead" "debt" and "dado." These vowels are diffeent.

So yes, it does only happen with R. So I guess it's not a full merger,
so far as I know. I had never thought of it that way.

I'm am going to write a document on mergers, explaining what they are,
and then try to group sets, rank the severity the problem the merger
presents, possible solutions, and example words. In truth, I don't know
a lot of different sets, but rather than my making another chart, I
think a merger document might be more useful to tackle the problem in a
more concrete way. I have been busy today (you can see why in my next
post), so I haven't gotten around to it.

Paul
